intro: Sarcostemma socotranum, commonly known as Socotra's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a waxy coating, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Sarcostemma socotranum plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
